newsitem.title: USA: Franklin Ophthalmic in debt agreement.
newsitem.headline: Franklin Ophthalmic in debt agreement.

text.p: Franklin Ophthalmic Instruments Co Inc said Thursday it reached an agreement with its major trade creditors.
Under the agreement, about $1 million of trade debt would either be converted to shares of the company's common stock, written off or converted to long-term notes.
The agreement is conditional on the company's principal lender, Silicon Valley Bank, converting about $3 million of Franklin Ophthalmic debt into shares of common stock at $1.52 each.

Franklin Ophthalmic said it already reached an agreement with the bank. It would take effect after the company received at least $1 million in capital and personal guarantees of certain officers of the company.
The company's agreements with trade creditors and the bank are part of Franklin Ophthalmic's overall plan to restructure its existing debt.
It also has negotiated increased lines of credit to be made available after the completion of the debt restructuring.
